Name: Captain Esperanza
Description:
Captain Esperanza is a strategy boardgame based on draft mechanics.

Each player drafts 5 five cards and then compare with other player to progress and earn gold and treasures. That all will give influence point at the end of the game.

Once a player reach Calicut, the game end and the player with the most influence point win the game.

Name: Dinosaur World: Ice Age Pack
Description:
There's a chill in the air... And these creatures feel right at home! The Ice Age Pack adds even more variety to your park with additional components and gameplay. Place these mammal enclosures anywhere in your park (yes, anywhere - even next to dinosaurs) and roll a special Ice die when activating them. You will also score adjacency bonuses  for these enclosures at the end of the game. However, you can only claim one bonus per creature you've built - so make sure to plan wisely!

Components:
- 6 animals (24 color meeples)
- 6 park tiles
- 1 die

-description from Kickstarter campaign

Name: For Science!: Sci Hard
Description:
The For Science!: Sci Hard expansion adds new challenges and more variety to the For Science! base game, with the components consisting of:


    6 wooden building blocks
    6 monochromatic wooden building blocks
    6 unique role cards
    20 unique design cards
    4 unique disease cards
    4 unique event cards
    4 unique mutation cards


--description from publisher

Name: For Science!: Exclusive Bonus Role Cards
Description:
Includes 3 new Role Cards to be mixed in with the rest:

    Plays a Scientist on TV
    Panic Containment Specialist
    Egregiously Serene Immunologist


--description from publisher

Name: たぎる交差 (Tagiru Crossing)
Description:
In this game two players compete to deduce each other's scoring criteria, and the one who is able to do so first, wins.

More specifically, each player has a set of nine strips of paper; three each in three colors, with each color having one strip of A's, B's, and C's (or dots, lines, and waves in the second edition). Each player takes three scoring chips at random from a selection of twelve and assigns them point values of +2, +1, or -1.  These criteria will look at the number of intersections of certain combinations, such as A strips crossing B strips, or red strips crossing other red strips.

The first player begins by playing one of their strips.  The second player continues, placing a strip such that it intersects the first strip.  Each player will then place one additional strip in turn, which must cross at least one strip, and may not make an intersection of more than 2 strips.

Once this is complete, each player calculates their sore.  They then communicate to their opponent how many times in total their three criteria were triggered, and how many total points were earned.  They only report these 2 numbers in total, and not broken down by each of the three criteria.

A three-minute deduction phase of the game then begins, as the players try to deduce which three scoring criteria the other player has in which slot.  If a player attempts a guess and is wrong, their opponent secretly looks at one of the unused criteria.

If neither player guesses correctly, the crossing pattern and scoring results remain, and the players play additional rounds as necessary (up to 4 total rounds) with the same scoring criteria and their remaining strips, until one player wins or the game ends in a draw.

Name: Living Planet: Deluxe Edition
Description:
The Deluxe edition is a large black box that has slots for the base game and all expansions.

It contains the core set which also came with content not found in the retail edition: the campaign book with 5 scenarios, 4 map tiles, 4 technical units, 5 spatioports, 3 recycling factory, plus component upgrades.

In addition, the deluxe edition came with Living Planet: Industria.


About the game:In Living Planet, each player represents one major Galactic Corporation exploiting the distant planet MYC.14.250. Each one of them is eager to industrialize the planet and generate as much profit as possible before the planet self-destructs.

To do so, you'll have to explore the planet to grow the map. You'll manage your team to extract resources with factory buildings you've built, and trade resources at the stock market to make money. And above anything else, you'll have to handle cataclysms generated by the planet. But cataclysms don't happen randomly, players trigger them through their actions, using their card set. Confrontation between players will take place through the planet.

Players will alternately take the leader role for each turn. Each turn follows a specific game turn sequence. Every player will have some actions to accomplish at a turn, in the order the Leader chooses, resolving the sequence : Resources production - Action (Explore, Move, Construct, Trade…) - Cataclysms.

At the end of the game each player will earn victory points based on how much money they have and how many buildings and vehicles they control.

-description from the publisher

Name: たぎる表裏 (Tagiru Hyōri)
Description:
In ãŸãŽã‚‹è¡¨è£ (Tagiru HyÅri), three players each have 1 two-sided card and compete to deduce which card each player holds.  Each player is able to see the front of their own card, and the back of the other two player's cards.

The game includes 10 two-sided number cards, and a several of question cards.  On a player's turn, they choose one of the question cards and ask it; some will be answered by each player, and some are directed to a specific player.

The first player to deduce the numbers on each side of the three cards wins.

Name: Run Fight or Die: Reloaded Promo Pack 1
Description:
This pack includes:

1 Suave Photographer
1 Elm Street
2 Survival Guides
2 Banjoes
Families: Players: Games with expansions that add solo play

Name: Run Fight or Die: Reloaded Promo Pack 2
Description:
This pack includes:

1 Zombie Cosplayer
1 Diner
2 Energy Bars
2 Flamethrowers
Families: Players: Games with expansions that add solo play

Name: Burgeon
Description:
Definition: "Burgeon - Begin to grow or increase rapidly"

Burgeon is a solo territory control game where you plant flowers and kill weeds.

The game starts on a 10x10 grid with three weeds randomly planted on the board and a weather token revealed above the board. Then the player draws three cards and uses two of them to plant flowers on the board that can kill the weeds. Careful where you plant the flowers however, some will kill your plants!

Each round the planted flowers and weeds grow, flourishing and spreading across the board depending on the weather. After 10 rounds, the game ends and points are scored to see if you win! The more flowers you have, the better your garden is and you gain more points. But if you have too many weeds, you'll get minus points and your garden will die.

—description from the designer

Name: D-Day and Beyond
Description:
D-Day and Beyond, June 6, 1944 through May 19, 1945

D-Day, the largest amphibious invasion in history, opened the final chapter of the war in Europe with the landings on four Normandy beaches.  For almost a year, General Eisenhower balanced Allied resources and clashing subordinates as he slowly drove back Field Marshal Karl von Rundstedt’s forces, who struggled with Hitler to command his theater forces. In late January 1945 the Rhine was breached and the end of the Third Reich drew nearer.

D-Day and Beyond is a tense, two-player operational board game covering the European theater from the French Atlantic and Mediterranean coasts to the dense German forests, the Siegfried line, and the Rhine River.  The Allied player faces the tough decision about where and when to land troops, what scarce air and naval resources to employ on offense or defense, and struggles to keep a coherent supply line to his forward troops.  The German player has to throw the landing(s) off the beach, if able, and failing that, fight a retrograde war that requires balancing holding key terrain, slowing the Allied advance, and preserving units.  Additional rules showcase the Resistance, rail movement, airborne operations, carpet bombing, the release of German reserves, and the infamous Wacht Am Rhein offensive known as Autumn Mist.

—description from the publisher
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: The Dwarves: The Triumph of the Dwarves
Description:
Included inside The Dwarves: The Duel but for use only with The Dwarves.

This small, 21-card expansion allows you to play through the adventures found in the 5th-chapter of the best-selling novel "The Dwarves". It will be the greatest challenge you had to face thus far.

Expansion contains 13 Scenario cards and 8 Special Equipment cards.

Cards are distinguished with the letters 'ToD' at the bottom right for identification.

Name: Mañópolis
Description:
In Manópolis you can build some of the most important monuments in the Zaragoza, such as the Basilica del Pilar, the Torre del Agua or the Palacio de la Aljafería, and conquer some of the ages of History that the city has lived by answering trivia questions about them.

It all depends on where the dice falls.

Immerse yourself in the history of Zaragoza and travel the board of Manópolis to live an exciting adventure. 
Through the different spaces you can... 
- Buy properties. Use those Cachirulos (the official currency of the game).
- Build properties. 
Your investment can pay off when other players visit your properties.
- Conquer the different eras (Ancient/Middles Ages/ Modern) to become an expert of the city. 
You must correctly answer at least 3 questions for each Age.

There are 2 ways to win the game. 
One is to be the best property owner, the other, the best historian.

Name: Legions of Steel: Reloaded
Description:
A fast paced, squad level miniatures wargame rich in tactical decision making. Take control of either the highly trained human forces, United Nations of Earth Commandos or the fearless machine forces comprised of G12 Nightmare robots and the dreaded Mark VII Assault Fiend. Various scenarios are included in the boxed set which you win by completing the mission objectives.

Legions of Steel is played over a series of rounds each comprised of an Initiative Segment, 2 player turns and an end segment. At the beginning of each Round the players roll a d6, higher roller winning initiative. The player with the initiative decides who will have the first turn this round, themselves or their opponent. The person whose turn it is, is considered the active player.

The active player activates each of their figures moving and attacking. Once a figure has been activated and its actions are finished, a marker is place next to that figure to indicate its state. If the figure attacked, a fired counter is placed next to it. If it did not fire, it is considered Covering which means that it is holding its attack for future use, including during the opponent's turn. Attacking at an opponent is accomplished through rolling a 6 sided die (sometimes more depending on the weapon and your tactical decision). There are various options for attacks including auto-firing, spreading your attack to multiple targets, hand to hand engagement and more that add to the tactical decision process. In addition, some figures have special abilities like Leadership or Extra Lives. With leadership a Sergeant figure can influence die results, allow troopers to move farther or command them to attack out of turn. The Mark VII Assault fiend has an extra life as it takes 2 hits to eliminate it from the game.

The tactical decisions in this game are many with plenty of player interaction. You will be jockeying your forces for tactical advantage, trying to get the upper hand from round to round.

—description from the publisher

Name: Metempsychosis: Abyss of Horrors
Description:
In this horror/dark fantasy solitaire card game with a philosophical/mystical story, a player represents a soul trying to break free from the cycle of nightmarish incarnations by enduring the right sequence of them, building an octave from cosmic tones, and getting to the higher, more peaceful level of being. He or she chooses from different cards with letters from A to G, depending on how much hostile each card is and if it fits the sequence he or she has already built. Every card represents an incarnation of the soul into a nightmarish life and the soul must endure them.

Each card harms the player in a different way and works with the pile or his hand in a different way depending on simple symbols with numbers on the cards (resources are: willpower, represented by a counter card to be covered by another card; and a number of the cards in the pile). There are also "keepers" in the game, tough bosses that prevent you from achieving your goal. The game is balanced in such a way, that usually loss lies very close to winning, and winning is quite hard (easy to play, hard to win). The game setting is just a few seconds  (setting only four "desperate cry" cards that can help you in desperate situations during the game; 1 willpower counter card; and shuffling the pile) and each game is only 10-30 minutes.

The game mechanism is based on using cards with the same letters or symbols (besides a letter, each card has a symbol or set of symbols too) to recycle them if you do not need the particular card at the moment or if you even need to get rid of it (in case of the keepers).

It consists of 40 full-colored cards, with a focus on dark art. No other components needed. The game has its own soundtrack in the Dungeon Synth genre.

—description from the publisher

Name: 無限回段 (Mugen Kaidan)
Description:
In ç„¡é™å›žæ®µ (Mugenkai Dan), players are climbing an "infinite" staircase; to create the staircase, the game has 2 boards showing six stairs each. One of the available actions in the game moves one of the boards to the other end, such that the stairs will go on.

To setup, each player takes a die of their color and a matching set of action tiles.

In each round, the players will perform two actions each.  First, they take turns choosing action tiles from their hand and placing them face down in a queue.  After the first tile is placed, future tiles are placed to the left or right, but once the 6 tiles have been placed, they will execute from left to right.  The actions do such things as move your dice up the stairs; move an entire stair board; score points; and swap dice.

The first player to score 5 points will win.

Name: Ponce de Leon
Description:
Ponce de Leon was a Spanish conqueror who came to Florida in 1523 with the intention to explore and colonize this new territory for the Kingdom of Spain. They say that being in Florida he heard an aboriginal legend about "The fountain of youth" and dedicate to search for it. They also said that the Kingdom of Portugal knew the intentions of Ponce and sent an expedition to find the fountain of youth before the Spaniards do it. 
A card game forming a map.  Dice and pawns to move thru the board.
The players will go from their ships thru the paths on the cards until they get The fountain of youth" and return to his/her ship.

—description from the publisher

Name: Strapo: Straßenpolizeispiel
Description:
There are three patrol cars (one player or team) who try to catch three traffic offenders (one player or team): a motorist, a pedestrian and a cyclist. The traffic offenders try to reach an individual destination. Movement is determined by a die. The players start on their starting places. If a player gets on a Z-Space he has to start anew. If a traffic offender gets on a M-space he gets a traffic rule card and has to pay a fine; cops have to go to space D (police station) before resuming the pursuit. If a traffic offender gets on the same space as another traffic offender he causes an accident and has to go to the police station before resuming his trip. Whenever a patrol car causes an accident with another patrol car it ist removed from the game. If a traffic offender and a patrol car get on the same space, the traffic offender is imprisoned for the rest of the game.

All fines go to the cops, but if a traffic offender reaches his destination, the cops have to pay him double the fines he has payed.

—user summary

Name: Crownfall
Description:
Crownfall is a 2-4 player game where players take turns flicking their army of Blinks at their opponent’s Blinks to try to knock them out of the battlefield.

SETUP
CHOOSE YOUR BATTLEFIELD
First, choose a smooth surface such as a floor or tabletop to be your battlefield, and set the boundaries of your arena (the edges of the table, or lines on the ground). Then create a real or imaginary line to divide the battlefield in half and choose a side. This determines where you can place your army during
the game.

ASSEMBLE YOUR ARMY
Next, take an even number of Blinks and divide them in half between the players. If playing with more than 2 people, players will need to group up into 2 teams.

Each team clusters their Blinks together and then single-clicks any Blink to swap between the two team colors.
To muster an army, triple-click any Blink in the cluster to turn it into a Crown. All other Blinks will become the army. Blinks will assign themselves one of 9 roles depending on how many Blinks they are away from the Crown Blink. As you play, try to find a unique setup formation that creates your 
perfect strategic army.

Finally, each team distributes their army throughout their side of the battlefield, making sure that no two Blinks are touching. The game then begins with the starting player’s turn.

GAMEPLAY
The goal of Crownfall is to reduce your opponent’s Crown to 0 health. Each turn, a player can perform up to 2 actions. A player can use one or both of their actions to flick one of their Blinks, generally with the goal of knocking enemy Blinks off the table, but sometimes to accomplish other strategic ends. Unless otherwise specified, a player cannot flick or activate the ability of the same Blink more than once in the same turn.

Players can also choose to activate the power of one of their army Blinks as an action. Many roles have a power that can be activated with an action, but several have passive powers which do not require an action. All powers are detailed at the end of the rules. If, during play, a Blink connects to another Blink, you must separate the two by 1 inch and rotate them so that they are no longer aligned to each other. Some powers may affect this rule.

If a Blink falls off the table or out of the bounds of the battlefield as the result of a flick, whether intentional or by accident, that Blink is dead - unless it’s a Crown or affected by a special ability. Set your dead Blinks to the side, out of the battlefield’s boundary but within reach of the players.

WIN CONDITION
The first player to lower their opponent’s Crown to 0 health wins!

To reset your army and start a new game - cluster your Blinks together and triple-click one of them to reset the cluster back to setup.

VARIANT RULES
Crownfall has multiple rule variations and alternative modes of play. For all variations and a more in-depth explanation of the rules, see the full instructions document online at blinks.games.

Name: History Heroes: Women
Description:
History Heroes: WOMEN in history quiz games contains individual, beautifully illustrated cards of forty of the greatest women throughout history to the present day from Cleopatra to Angela Merkel.

Each card is illustrated to represent the individual Woman in history and shows her dates, her flag of birthplace and seven gripping facts about her, including a joker fact about each character to surprise and/or entertain. The History Heroes: WOMEN in history quiz game represents a fantastic, diverse range of amazing women.

Many characters will be familiar to all – from Cleopatra to our present-day Elizabeth II; from Catherine the Great to Margaret Thatcher. There are female monarchs, political leaders, scientists, artists, writers and performers. There are explorers and campaigners too, many who have risked their lives for their causes. All are inspirational and all have contributed significantly to the shape of our world today.

How to Play
There are many ways of playing History Heroes quiz card games. Each pack gives suggestions on how to play, or you can make up your own rules if everyone playing agrees to them!

Win the game by winning the character cards, and you win the cards by guessing/knowing the facts about each History Hero. You can use the images as clues and you can use the different levels of facts to make it as easy or as hard as you want to play the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: History Heroes: Artists
Description:
History Heroes ARTISTS is a fun game about forty of the most famous artists in art history.  
The game contains fantastically illustrated cards, packed with facts about 40 of the greatest artists from 15th century Botticelli and Artemesia Gentileschi to today’s Yayoi Kusama and David Hockney. Read and enjoy all the facts and try to win the cards by guessing who the famous artist is from the facts read out on the cards. Do you know which artist is a great fan of Walt Disney and who changed their name at least 30 times during their lifetime? Do you know how Impressionism got its name? If you know the answers, you can win the cards. If not,  discover these and learn SO many more facts about art by playing History Heroes: ARTISTS

How to Play
There are many ways of playing History Heroes quiz card games. Each pack gives suggestions on how to play, or you can make up your own rules if everyone playing agrees to them! Win the game by winning the character cards, and you win the cards by guessing/knowing the facts about each History Hero. You can use the images as clues and you can use the different levels of facts to make it as easy or as hard as you want to play the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: History Heroes: Children
Description:
History Heroes: CHILDREN in history quiz card game Children includes individual cards of History Heroes’ forty children throughout history, who have helped change the world and the lives of those around them. Each card is fantastically illustrated to represent the specific Child Hero and shows their dates, their flag of birthplace and seven memorable and often moving facts about them.

History Heroes’ Children range from leaders, such as the ‘boy king’, Tutankhamun, Joan of Arc and the Dalai Lama to campaigners, such as Malala Yousafzai, the nineteenth century Match girls and America’s civil rights campaigner, Claudette Colvin, who, aged 15, led her own protest on a bus against segregation in Alabama nine months before Rosa Park’s famous stand for equal rights. Child prodigy performers and artists such as Mozart and Picasso rub shoulders with Shirley Temple and Stevie Wonder. Children, who led extraordinary lives, such as Laura Ingalls Wilder, Helen Keller, Victor of Aveyron & Mary Anning mingle with Child heroes, who simply ‘made’ history: Lady Jane Grey, the Princes in the Tower, Victor of Aveyron, Louise Brown…the game contains an extraordinary, inspirational range of boys and girls in history.

How to Play
There are many ways of playing History Heroes quiz card games. Each pack gives suggestions on how to play, or you can make up your own rules if everyone playing agrees to them!

Win the game by winning the character cards, and you win the cards by guessing/knowing the facts ab out each History Hero. You can use the images as clues and you can use the different levels of facts to make it as easy or as hard as you want to play the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: History Heroes: Explorers
Description:
History Heroes’ Explorers are history quiz cards containing individual cards of History Heroes’ forty greatest Explorers. Each card is fantastically illustrated to represent the individual Explorer Hero and shows the explorer’s dates, their flag of birthplace and seven gripping facts about them, including a joker fact about each Explorer to surprise and/or entertain.

History Heroes’ Explorers stretch back in time to Pytheas in the first century BCE and cover land, marine, submarine and lunar exploration from then until the present day. Neil Armstrong ‘rubs shoulders’ with Roald Amundsen and Ibn Battuta; Ranulph Fiennes with Leif Erikson and Yuri Gagarin; Amelia Earhart with Sir Francis Drake and Sylvia Earle;  James Cameron with Pedro Cabral and Christopher Columbus to name a few.

How to Play
There are many ways of playing History Heroes quiz card games. Each pack gives suggestions on how to play, or you can make up your own rules if everyone playing agrees to them!

Win the game by winning the character cards, and you win the cards by guessing/knowing the facts ab out each History Hero. You can use the images as clues and you can use the different levels of facts to make it as easy or as hard as you want to play the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: History Heroes: Inventors
Description:
History Heroes INVENTORS fun history games include individual cards of 40 inventors, who have changed our world with inventions we see and use every day.
Each card is fantastically illustrated to represent the specific Inventor and shows their dates, their flag of birthplace and seven memorable and often moving facts about them.

Did you know that Alexander Graham Bell, inventor of the telephone, received his well-known middle name as an 11th birthday gift from his father?

And, whilst most might know that Florence Nightingale was the founder of modern nursing, how many realise that she is also credited as the inventor of the mathematical pie chart? Test yourself with these facts and many more in the game.

How to Play
There are many ways of playing History Heroes quiz card games. Each pack gives suggestions on how to play, or you can make up your own rules if everyone playing agrees to them!

Win the game by winning the character cards, and you win the cards by guessing/knowing the facts ab out each History Hero. You can use the images as clues and you can use the different levels of facts to make it as easy or as hard as you want to play the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Solarion: Foundation of Empires
Description:
A galaxy of conquering species have come up from a vast array of histories. Their desire for exploration and expansion throughout the galaxy to propagate their kind foretells a dark time for the peaceful ancient species on existing planets. Destructive events are on the horizon.

In Solarion: Foundation of Empires, players will be attempting to control a hex-tile galaxy with a deck of technologies and strategies hoping to gain control of resource producing planets, worlds habitable for colonists, and valuable Solarion planets for end game scoring. The game uses a technology deck divided into 3 parts fueling a card row for purchases similar to other deck builders. Three scorings occur over the course of play with different scoring cards for each. The game ends when either the last deck of cards is depleted, or a player has used their last colonist.

After these galactic ages, players count up their points and the most epic species is the new overlord of the galaxy.

—description from the designer

Name: History Heroes: Kings & Queens
Description:
History Heroes: KINGS & QUEENS quiz card game contains individual, beautifully illustrated cards of Forty key British kings and queens from Alfred the Great to Elizabeth II.

Each card is illustrated to represent the individual monarch in history and shows their dates, her ‘house’ and seven gripping facts about them, including a joker fact about each character to surprise and/or entertain. Discover which monarch’s huge stomach exploded during his (oops, a bit of a clue there!) funeral, creating a terrible stench, and who was described by one Victorian historian as ‘the most perfect character in history’.

Bonus!
KINGS & QUEENS game also contains a card with the famous rhyme to help all players remember the order of all the kings and queens from 1066 to the present day.

How to Play
There are many ways of playing History Heroes quiz card games. Each pack gives suggestions on how to play, or you can make up your own rules if everyone playing agrees to them!

Win the game by winning the character cards, and you win the cards by guessing/knowing the facts ab out each History Hero. You can use the images as clues and you can use the different levels of facts to make it as easy or as hard as you want to play the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: History Heroes: London
Description:
History Heroes’ LONDON quiz card game contains fantastically illustrated, fact-packed, individual cards of forty of the greatest characters in the Capital’s impressive history.

The game contains the people, who helped make and shape London both physically and culturally. Characters, who  built and, in some cases, destroyed London, such as Boudica, the Romans, Christopher Wren and Richard Rogers, rub shoulders with those who have given London its fantastic, rich cultural history too, such as Shakespeare, Laurence Olivier, David Bowie, Mo Farah and Vivienne Westwood.

How to Play
There are many ways of playing History Heroes quiz card games. Each pack gives suggestions on how to play, or you can make up your own rules if everyone playing agrees to them!

Win the game by winning the character cards, and you win the cards by guessing/knowing the facts ab out each History Hero. You can use the images as clues and you can use the different levels of facts to make it as easy or as hard as you want to play the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Super Computer: Security Expansion
Description:
This is the exciting first expansion to the fast-paced and addictive Super Computer card game. Hackers have handed you tools to sabotage your competition.  As you're busy building your computer, drop a worm or a virus on to an opponent's build to slow them down.  Desperate for a CPU, grab a buggy one and throw it into your rig.  It works . . . most of the time.  All the while you need to protect yourself by adding a shield and a UPS.

This expansion adds a whole new twist to the game, turning would be friends into rivals.

—description from the designer

Name: History Heroes: Scientists
Description:
History Heroes SCIENTISTS is a fun science game and a great way to discover the greatest scientists throughout history and the science they introduced to the world.

Our pack of Scientists contains individual cards of History Heroes’ forty greatest Scientist heroes. Each science quiz card is fantastically illustrated to represent the individual Scientist Hero and shows the scientist’s dates, their flag of birthplace and seven gripping facts about them, including a joker fact about each scientist to surprise and/or entertain.

Our Scientist Heroes start with first century BCE scientists, who introduced scientific concepts that we still rely on today: Archimedes and Aristotle. The game includes scientists from so many subsequent centuries to the present day: great names, and their achievements, such as Copernicus, Galileo, Sir Isaac Newton, Robert Boyle and Bunsen. On past the likes of Huxley, Jenner, Darwin and Curie and on to our twentieth and twenty first century heroes, such as Rontgen, Rutherford, Joliot-Curie, Hodgkin, Franklin and Hawking.

How to Play
There are many ways of playing History Heroes science quiz cards. Each pack gives suggestions on how to play, or you can make up your own rules if everyone playing agrees to them!

Win the game by winning the character cards, and you win the cards by guessing/knowing the facts ab out each History Hero. You can use the images as clues and you can use the different levels of facts to make it as easy or as hard as you want to play the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Super Computer: Retro Expansion
Description:
Retro is in at Scrappy Computers, or at least that's what the management thinks.  Companies are paying big for Super Computers with Retro-Style configurations.  This expansion includes new parts and new builds to challenge the best techs.  There are also some surprises.

Step back in time and customize your very own Super Computer complete with Floppy Disk Drive, Dot Matrix printers and the good old CRT display.

This expansion allows you to satisfy existing builds with more classic parts, or build some totally retro-builds for major bonus points.  Whatever your goal, this expansion gives you new opportunities to construct the most powerful super computer possible out of scrap parts.

—description from the designer

Name: History Heroes: Space
Description:
History Heroes’ SPACE is a fun quiz card game containing individual cards of forty of the most significant characters in Space’s history.

In this era of renewed fascination and ever-increasing hunger for space exploration, History Heroes’ SPACE quiz card game gives a fantastic overview of 40 characters and objects that have made space exploration possible.

It looks at the scientists who developed our understanding of our Universe from Aristotle to Einstein. It includes novelists, such as HG Wells and Jules Vernes, who both foretold so much of our world, and who inspired the Space engineers to dream. Characters, such as JFK, Walt Disney and Elon Musk have helped push the dream. And let’s not forget the objects and characters, such as Sputnik 1, Katherine Johnson, Neil Armstrong, Laika and Tim Peake, who have actually made Space exploration happen.

How to Play
There are many ways of playing History Heroes quiz card games. Each pack gives suggestions on how to play, or you can make up your own rules if everyone playing agrees to them!

Win the game by winning the character cards, and you win the cards by guessing/knowing the facts ab out each History Hero. You can use the images as clues and you can use the different levels of facts to make it as easy or as hard as you want to play the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: History Heroes: Sport
Description:
History Heroes’ Sports Heroes quiz card game, contains individual cards of History Heroes’ forty greatest Sports Heroes. Each card is fantastically illustrated to represent the individual sportsperson and shows their dates, their flag of birthplace and seven gripping facts about them, including a joker fact about each Sports Hero to surprise and/or entertain

Sports Heroes start with the first century BCE Athenian, Pheidippides, said to be the first person to run the marathon. Then charge forwards with heroes like Captain Webb, WG Grace, de Coubertin, who helped devise the modern Olympics, Suzanne Lenglen, Jesse Owens,  Sonia Henie, Don Bradman, Juan Fangio, Tanni Grey-Thompson and many more. Heroes in Sports come from a range of sports, such as athletics, boxing, football, golf, F1 racing, tennis, rugby, baseball, cricket, basketball, gymnastics, ice skating and squash.

How to Play
There are many ways of playing History Heroes quiz card games. Each pack gives suggestions on how to play, or you can make up your own rules if everyone playing agrees to them!

Win the game by winning the character cards, and you win the cards by guessing/knowing the facts ab out each History Hero. You can use the images as clues and you can use the different levels of facts to make it as easy or as hard as you want to play the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: History Heroes: World War I
Description:
History Heroes: WORLD WAR 1 is just one of our educational card games.
This pack contains individual cards of history’s forty greatest World War I Heroes. Each card is fantastically illustrated to represent the specific World War One Hero and shows their dates, their flag of birthplace and seven memorable and often moving facts about them.

World War 1 Heroes start with the great unsung heroes: all the animals who served in World War 1 – they all share one card, otherwise there wouldn’t be room for anyone else in the game! 
World War I History Heroes covers military figures like ‘Black Jack’ Pershing, Marshal Joffre and Field-Marshal Haig. King George and his cousins, Kaiser Wilhelm II and Tsar Nicholas II feature along with political leaders like Lloyd George and Woodrow Wilson.  
Heroes who shaped and influenced World War 1 from Edith Cavell to Winston Churchill, from Flora Sandes to Siegfried Sasson and from Walter Tull to the Tunnelling Companies. You’ll find these and many more in World War 1 History Heroes

How to Play
There are many ways of playing History Heroes quiz card games. Each pack gives suggestions on how to play, or you can make up your own rules if everyone playing agrees to them!

Win the game by winning the character cards, and you win the cards by guessing/knowing the facts ab out each History Hero. You can use the images as clues and you can use the different levels of facts to make it as easy or as hard as you want to play the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: History Heroes: World War II
Description:
History Heroes: World War II educational card games contain individual cards of forty of the most significant characters in World War Two. Each card is fantastically illustrated to represent the relevant character and shows their dates, their flag of birthplace and seven memorable and often moving facts about them.

History Heroes: World War II characters are ‘heroes’ AND ‘anti-heroes’ unsurprisingly. They range from the key political and military figures, such as Chamberlain, Churchill, Roosevelt, Eisenhower, Hitler, Stalin, Mussolini, Emperor Hirohito, Field Marshal Montgomery, Rommel and the like to many others, who shaped and influenced World War Two. Great innovators, such as Barnes Wallis, institutions and courageous people, such as Oskar Schindler, Evacuees, The Women’s Land Army, Raoul Wallenberg and Kindertransport all appear on cards in the game. The sweep of characters in the game is stark, moving and often inspiring.

How to Play
There are many ways of playing History Heroes quiz card games. Each pack gives suggestions on how to play, or you can make up your own rules if everyone playing agrees to them!

Win the game by winning the character cards, and you win the cards by guessing/knowing the facts about each History Hero. You can use the images as clues and you can use the different levels of facts to make it as easy or as hard as you want to play the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Ligue en Or
Description:
Ligue en Or: The French football board game, in which you find the 20 clubs of the Uber Eats League 1, in the form of a real tournament.
The goal is to win the championship with your favorite team, among the 20 clubs in Ligue 1.

The game is divided in 2 phases.

     First phase the teams are getting bought, on a map of France.
     Second phase: tournament phase: teams faces each other and games are resolved using dice. The board is now in the form of stadium. 


The goal is to reach the grand finale.

And bring your club to the Champions League !

Name: The Magicians: Battle the Beast
Description:
The Magicians: Battle the Beast is a limited edition board game  based on Season 2 of the TV show The Magicians. The board game was sent to reviewers as a press kit in 2016.

Travel from Brakebills to Fillory as you attempt to stop the Beast. You might get turned into a goose and fly to Brakebills South or get lost in the Neitherlands. Every time something goes wrong, you must drink...just like your favorite characters on The Magicians TV show!

The game comes with six shot glasses (each bearing the initial of a The Magicians character), a board, cards, dice, and tokens.

Name: Mysteries Of Alchemy
Description:
Mysteries of Alchemy is an At Home Mystery. Think of it like an escape room you can do at home! In this game you're searching for hidden clues and puzzles in beautifully created notes from an alchemists' apprentice.

The notes are sent to you by James, the butler of late Bram van Amstel. One of the first professional treasure hunters from the previous century. Try to unravel the puzzles and clues to find the treasure! You can play alone or with friends. You might be really surprised when you finally find the treasure and see what it is.

—description from the publisher

Name: Marco Polo II: The Caravans
Description: Mini-expansion for Marco Polo II including 4 new characters and a new mechanism allowing to load caravans with goods in order to exchange them for other goods or VPs.
Families: Game: The Voyages of Marco Polo

Name: Create your Dictator
Description:
In chaotic times people call for a strong leader. But the question is: who will be this strong leader? In Create Your Dictator you aren’t one of the leaders, but you are the puppeteer behind the potential dictator, their "right hand man". You control them by using smart moves, intelligent timing and by using secret missions to sabotage others.

But even if the potential dictator of your choice becomes the dictator of the world, you are not alone. You will battle other puppeteers, who will try to overthrow you. Will you prevail to rule them all?

Play your cards right, overturn the race with hidden conspiracies and always make sure you control the winning candidate by saving all the cards you have on them.

—description from the designer

Name: Carcassonne Maps: USA East
Description:
With Carcassonne Maps we offer you a new possibility to play Carcassonne. With Carcassonne Maps: USA East you can use your tiles and meeples in USA East, build cities and influence the course of important raids. There are also new ways to score points, e.g. by winning the scoring of a big city or by connecting streets to neighboring countries.

The map consists of high-quality, strong, linen-embossed paper and has the size A1.

Name: Carcassonne Maps: USA West
Description:
With Carcassonne Maps we offer you a new possibility to play Carcassonne. With Carcassonne Maps: USA West you can use your tiles and meeples in USA West, build American cities and influence the course of important roads. There are also new ways to score points, e.g. by winning the scoring of a big city or by connecting streets to neighbouring countries.

The map consists of high-quality, strong, linen-embossed paper and has the size A1.

Name: Stronghold: Undead (Second Edition) – Holy Order Cards
Description:
Defender may invite to his Stronghold Priests from one of the four different Monasteries - each with a uniqe ability.

—description from the publisher

Name: Stronghold: Undead (Second Edition) – Courage Cards
Description:
Set of 12 Courage cards which rewards the Defender for keeping the Panic level low.

—description from the publisher

Name: Stronghold: Undead (Second Edition) – Alternate Units
Description:
Six new unit cards invader can choose at the start of the battle to diversify his strategy with their unique abilities.

Contains:

     6 Invader unit cards
     1 bag
     40 blue wooden cubes
     65 gray wooden cubes
     25 black wooden cubes


—description from the publisher

Name: The Backyardigans: Kleuren & Getallen
Description:
With this card game kids learn to deal with colors and numbers in a playful manner. The game is all about collecting sets of card, either from the same color or the same number... All with the help of the Backyardigans.

—description from the back of the box (translated)

Name: Bang! Bang!
Description:
Bang! Bang! is a two player strategy skirmish game where you go head to head as commanders leading your squad of soldiers onto a battlefield in an attempt to eliminate each other. The only tools at your disposal are the Combat Card, your wits, and the roll of the dice.

The game is split into three phases. You begin in the Spawn Phase, placing your squad onto the map, choosing carefully where to set them along the orange spawn clicks. Clicks are the spots on the board used to determine movement. Once both players finish the Spawn Phase, you then enter the first Move Phase. Start by taking your units using a limited number of moves out of their spawn while attempting to establish line of sight so you can take shots at the enemy. Both players go through one Move phase without firing shots. After your second Move Phase is finished, you enter the Kill Phase and get to take any shots you have available by rolling the dice. Once your Kill phase is over, the turn goes to your opponent, and he gets to do the same by Moving then Killing.

Each class of soldier is unique and has an ideal range for engagement. The Sniper and Light Machine Gun are best from a distance, the Shotgun and Sub-Machine Gun are great up close, and the Assault Rifle has a sweet spot in the middle.

The Combat Card details every soldier's stats, and will show you what you need to roll to land a killshot. After you've taken your shots, any soldiers you hit get the chance to roll for cover, and if they make it, will stay alive and get to keep fighting!

Bang! Bang! uses a classic Deathmatch win condition, so the first person to fully eliminate the enemy squad wins. It comes with three maps of varying difficulty, giving players a fresh battle experience as they improve.

-description from designer

Name: The World Game: Board Game
Description:
Race around the world, pass famous landmarks, learn about countries, recognize flags and find locations on the map. Spend quality time with your family and friends.

Answer questions like: 
Can you recognize the flag of Chile?
What is the capital of India?
Can you show Sweden on the map?

Steal cards with a pirate attack, send players back with a tsunami, freeze them with a snow storm and so much more! Packed with action, knowledge and endless fun!

GAMEPLAY:

The game's objective is to be the first player to finish the race around the world and cross the finish line. You move forward by winning with strong country facts or by answering geography challenges correctly.

Every turn each player draws a card from the country card pile. When it’s your turn, roll one dice. Then you have to choose between 2 options. Calling out a fact or a challenge.

FACT
Pick a fact you believe is the strongest one and try to beat other players. But be careful, if you lose someone else will move forward.

CHALLENGE
Yell challenge! The player to your left will challenge you with recognizing the flag, or finding a country on the map. If you decide on the hard challenge, you can even guess the capital city of a country. If you are playing with kids, they can guess the continent of a country. If you answer wrong, the next player gets a chance. If everyone answers wrong, the challenger moves forward.

Name: A Cold and Resolute Fight: The Battle for Narvik, April-June, 1940
Description:
The German invasion of Demark and Norway, Operation WeserÅ±bung, was a bold gamble by the invaders. The greatest risk for the Germans was at the northern most all weather port of Narvik. Here the Germans landed troops that quickly overwhelmed the local Norwegian garrison but left them entirely dependent upon supplies and reinforcements that would arrive by ship or air transport. The Allies recognized the German’s vulnerability and sent the Royal Navy into the Narvik fjord where their warships quickly sank all of the German vessels. With winter weather persisting, air transport would never be able to provide sufficient levels of men and material to sustain the now trapped German invaders. The Allies sent a mixed nationality force of British, French and Poles to support the Norwegian defense forces that were laying siege to the Germans. What resulted was an epic contest that threatened to unravel the Nazi blitzkrieg. Perhaps you can do as well or better?

Each copy of A Cold and Resolute Fight is composed of the following:

•    Two 11 by 17 inch map sheets
•    One sheet of 120 double-sided counters
•    This set of rules.

Players will also need a standard deck of cards, one six-sided die (D6) and an opaque container (mug, envelope or anything similar) to play the game.

Most units are battalions of 700 to 800 men and their equipment (German KG are slightly smaller). Tank units represent 6-10 vehicles. A turn represents one week of time and a hex is slightly more than 2.5 miles across.

A Cold and Resolute Fight is designed by Paul Rohrbaugh and features graphics by Nils Johansson.

-description from designer

Name: Brúnó Budapesten Dunafutam
Description:
Brúnó visits his parents at the Budapest Zoo, and then they go by car to the Kopaszi Dam, where they also run into the Orsi family. Players also have to go along the road, through the bridges of Budapest. Who will reach the finish line soonest? The journey may be long, but it’s no wonder there are plenty to see. Little travelers have to roll the dice first, then follow the instructions on the given field and move towards the goal!

The rules are simple and easy to follow and you can play a game in an average of 15-20 minutes.

The drawings of Erika Bartos acquaint the children with the famous buildings, public spaces and bridges of Budapest in a simplified, yet perfectly recognizable way.

After the highly successful Brúnó board game collection in Budapest, now the Danube and its bridges have taken the lead.

Board games can be easily and wonderfully linked to Brúnó Budapest books. Playing to get acquainted with the image and sights of the capital as a young child.

Name: Pensilly
Description:
Have you ever tried to draw on a rumbling train or draw a maze puzzle on a spin washing machine? No??? No wonder, since drawing in calm conditions on a secure basis may be best. And then comes this rounded giant pencil that keeps squirming, vibrating. With this, try to put together a normal figure. It’s very funny when you can’t draw a simple picture like an apple because of the constant squirming-twitching of your drawing tool. And then we didn’t even talk about the more complicated images. We tried and laughed a lot. A real good party game for kids, but also a good party for adults.
Adult companies can also undertake to draw more complex diagrams. The set includes 2 felt-tip pens, which can be replaced with tools of the same size. It can be played as a team game, like activity.

Name: Movie Plotz: Bonus Features
Description:
An expansion game (bonus cards) that is played after you create the movie.

These cards are shuffled and one is taken randomly, or in competitive play - the first person voted thumbs down gets to take their pick.

After the film is complete, each player gets their chance to add their version of the bonus features. There will be lots of callbacks to the movie, and in some cases, a little revenge by the players that were down voted by their screenwriting peers.

Name: Movie Plotz: Behind the Scenes
Description:
In a world... where players make their own movies, using just 12 cards and their wild imaginations. Starring [insert actor here] and written by [insert your name here], the games you play will leave you laughing, crying, and forever changed. It's time to make some movies!

A book featuring 20+ ways to play the game. Some great team building and competitive variants in there.

Alex has been hard at work making LOTS of variations on Movie Plotz. There's a 2 player "Gotcha Game" where players must force cards on their opponent, a team "Combo Pitch" where teams huddle up and hone their pitch before presenting it in a head-to-head battle of scripts, a "Classroom Edition" where a student starts the movie and passes it on, and many more.

Name: The Stalking Terror
Description:
It was supposed to be a fun day at the haunted corn maze. However, little did you know the corn maze was actually haunted. Not only that, but a strange small town cult who worships the corn is trying to summon a demon scarecrow from the netherworld--and they have plans to sacrifice you. Now, separated from your friends, can you escape the maze?

The Stalking Terror is a single page Roll + Write RPG using the Delve12 system.

—description from the publisher

Name: Tag Team: Commerce Road Cobra Khans
Description:
This is a full extra crew that you can swap in or out of your games (or play with an extra player). You can also mix and match crews to make a custom one. It includes one set of 7 Cobras and 1 Reference Card.

These days it's not enough to be the toughest crew on the streets; you need to make sure everyone knows it, too. Bring enough cans of spray paint to tag walls all over town, and enough muscle to make sure no one else does. There's nothing quite as satisfying as watching little punks drop their spray cans and run at the very sight of you — just make sure that there isn't someone even bigger right around the corner!

In Tag Team, you play as a crew of Eagles, Bulldogs, Alligators or Gorillas, defending your turf by bluffing your way through battles each day. Players simultaneously reveal their leader characters, and, if nobody backs down, their backup characters join the fight. The winner tags their opponent's territory as a reward. In the end, the crew with the most tagged territory wins.

Each version of Tag Team is fully playable and includes two characters. With both versions (and the small Cobras expansion), you can mix and match characters.

Name: Dobbeltime
Description:
Dobbeltime is a dice game, which is about speed and reaction time.

Each player has a scorecard with numbers from 1-12 in green, black, blue, yellow and red. The goal is to be the first player to make a vertical, horizontal and diagonal row of five numbers.

The active player rolls all the six dices (1 white, 1 black, 1 red, 1 green, 1 blue and 1 yellow). At the moment the dices are on the table, every player can find a number by adding the value on the white dice and the value of one of the coloured (except white) dices. The active player also has the possibility to find a number with only one of the coloured. When a player finds a number, the player needs to put a hand on the base and needs to say the number and the color. If the player is right, he can put a cross on the number. If the player is wrong the player should put a cross in the wrong area.

The first player with a row of five numbers, wins the game

—description from the designer

Name: Twin Stars: Adventure Series –  Series I Droid Assistants
Description:
3 Droid Assistant cards were offered during the original Kickstarter project as stretch goals, each being unlocked one at a time.

After the Kickstarter, the droids are available to buy for an additional $2.

Droids generally help you along the way but with a potential downside if they malfunction! They add an interesting "third character" to any Twin Stars scenario, giving you something else to think about and manage.

The series I droids are:

- C.R.A.N.K.
- MC-CY (Mickey)
- Domino 2-5

The droid assistant cards are "half-sized" cards, measuring at: 2.5" x 1.75" or 63mm x 44mm.

Name: Twin Stars: Adventure Series –  Series II Droid Assistants
Description:
3 new Droid Assistant cards were offered during the original Kickstarter project as a "Free Expansion".

After the Kickstarter, the droids are available to buy for an additional $2.

Droids generally help you along the way but with a potential downside if they malfunction! They add an interesting "third character" to any Twin Stars scenario, giving you something else to think about and manage.

The series II droids are:

- F1D0
- T.R.IX
- MANTIS

The droid assistant cards are "half-sized" cards, measuring at: 2.5" x 1.75" or 63mm x 44mm.

Name: Twin Stars: Adventure Series II – SYZYGY Mode II: Waypoint
Description:
After getting out of debt, you find yourselves on the other side of the universe. In order to get home, you'll have to use waypoints to jump light years in the right direction. However, waypoint access codes are one-time use, and very hard to come by...

In order to do so, you are trekking across the universe, taking on any job that you can, hoping to earn fast credits, and more importantly, make it out alive.

A new Syzygy Mode campaign booklet were offered during the original Kickstarter project as a "Free Expansion".

"Lost in the Galaxy's outer crust, you'll do anything to find your way back home. Guide 3 characters through a series of scenarios that carry over into each other."

Syzygy Mode is a campaign that allows you to play multiple scenarios one after another, in a nice and interconnected way.

Name: Imagineers: Orange Park Promo Tiles
Description:
10 new tiles for Imagineers.
Rules:
- Shuffle these tiles in with the others during step B of the game set up.
- During the Move Guests phase, the orange tiles match both yellow Guests and red Guests for scoring purposes.
- The Rainbow Park tile matches all three Guests colors.

Name: Triathlon: The Card Game
Description:
Triathlon is a game for 3 to 9 players that has more gameplay options than your typical run-based card game. These options include the ability to play Injury Cards on your opponents to slow them down, playing Adrenaline Rush Cards to take a card even when it is not your turn, and, due to the fact that every player has their own discard pile, players are given more options for selecting a card at the beginning of their turn.

The three stages (runs) needed to win the game are:
 • Stage One: A run of five cards that can be a mixture of colors and suits
 • Stage Two: A run of five cards in a single suit or all the same color
 • Stage Three: A run of five cards all being of the same suit and color

To help in accomplishing the stages, Triathlon has three suits; swimmers, cyclists, and runners, and three colors; red, blue, and golden. This gives Triathlon 9 unique sets of cards. Each set has eight cards, 7 numbered cards, and a Pro Card. Pro Cards are wild in number but cannot change their color or suit.

In addition to the cards mentioned above, the deck also contains three Super Pro Cards that are wild in number and color, but cannot change their suit.
 -description from designer

Name: Greed
Description:
Greed is played with a standard 52-card deck divided into greed cards (all the courts) and number cards (all others). Each player gets an equal number of greed cards and the number cards are dealt out (with one player getting an extra card in the three-player game).

Players take turns to play one card, which can either go in front of them or in the middle of the table, in either case covering any card previously there. Aces can be played to other players' piles but cannot cover greed cards.

Greed cards can only be played to own's one pile, and in this case the player scores the total of the cards showing on the table (i.e., on top of any of the four or five piles) before placing it. Greed cards and aces are worth zero; all other cards are worth their face value, but positive if black and negative if red. Any other player with a greed card on top of their pile scores the same amount as the active player.

After a player has played a greed card they must play on their own pile next turn to cover it.

Name: Warcaster: Neo-Mechanika – Collision Course Expansion
Description:
Collision Course is the first expansion for the Warcaster: Neo-Mechanika tabletop miniatures game, taking battles over the Thousand Worlds to the next level with:

24 new Cypher cards, including Faction Cyphers to make your rack truly distinct!
And the Collision Course rules booklet that contains:

6 new scenarios for Skirmish and Full Battle games
New rules for mantlets
Rules for adding vehicles to your battle force and rules and scenarios for Race Mode, a new way to play Warcaster with a focus on vehicular combat
Expanded lore on the all-new Empyrean Faction

-description from publisher

Name: Bolt Action: Campaign – D-Day: British & Canadian Sectors
Description:
Bolt Action: Campaign – D-Day: British & Canadian Sectors
This campaign book focuses on some of the key clashes fought in Normandy in the summer of 1944 as British, Canadian, Polish, and other Allied forces engaged in desperate battles against a dedicated and determined German opposition. As well as summarising the history, this book also details a number of scenarios inspired by the engagements within the Normandy campaign, and the special rules required to play them.

This book tells the story of the British and Canadian contribution to this monumental task, and the stoic German resistance they faced. It guides Bolt Action players from the latter stages of D-Day, beginning with the fierce fighting in the coastal towns off the beaches at Gold, Juno and Sword, through the violent clashes around the strategically vital city of Caen, and to the march against Germany itself.

Inside, you’ll find thirteen diverse scenarios, covering the action from the first pushes inland, to the dramatic climax of the campaign in the British & Canadian sectors during Operationâ€¯Tractable.â€¯ We’ve also included army lists for four of the campaign’s most important forces – the Canadian Army, the battle-hardened Commandos, the fanatical 12th SS Panzer Division ‘Hitlerjugend’, and the Luftwaffe Field Division. These new army lists add a whole new dimension of play, allowing you to create themed forces for your campaigns in Normandy!

Also included is a whole stable of new special characters, including the VC-winning medic Corporal Frederick Topham, who put life and limb on the line to rescue wounded men, and the fanatical Kurt ‘Panzer’ Meyer, who earned his Iron Cross leading the â€¯Liebstandarteâ€¯division’s reconnaissance battalion in Russia. These special characters are the perfect opportunity to theme your force further and make for amazing conversion opportunities.

—description from the publisher

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Second Edition): General's Handbook 2020
Description:
The essential 2020 General’s Handbook updates the core ruleset to enhance your games of Warhammer Age of Sigmar. No matter how you like to play, there’s something in here for you.

This edition contains:

     The Player’s Code
     New open play rules: Skies of Slaughter, Open War Coalition Battle Generator
     New narrative play rules: The Whisper Engine, Team Battle Special Rules, Coalition of Death, The Anvil of Apotheosis
     New matched play rules: updated Pitched Battles for the 2020 season, 12 Pitched Battle battleplans, Meeting Engagements, Pitched Battle Coalition of Death, Coalition Matrix
     Conquest Unbound
     Open War army and terrain generators
     Pitched Battle profiles


—description from the publisher

Name: Monopoly: Real Betis Balompié
Description:
A Monopoly about the Real Betis Balompié, created in 1907.

Play classic Monopoly, but this time being a professional sports manager. Invest in stands and stadiums, rent and spend the money in the official store.

Roll the dice and move around the board thanks to the pawns and travel through the best of the history of Los Verdiblancos - stadiums, best players, and the great victories in team history.

Live the life of a great manager in the fast-paced world of professional sports.
Put yourself in the shoes of a successful Real Betis Balompié manager.
Travel through the best of Betis history: stadiums, the best players and the great victories that made us vibrate with joy.
Invest in stands and stadiums, receive rent and spend the money in the official store.
Be smart and watchful, because there is only room for one at the top. Bankruptcy awaits the rest.
Now, Real Betis fans have the chance to continue enjoying this exclusive official edition of MONOPOLY.

Vive la vida de un gran gestor en el vertiginoso mundo del deporte profesional. Ponte en el lugar de un exitoso manager del Real Betis Balompié.
Viaja por lo mejor de la historia del Betis : estadios, los mejores jugadores y las grandes victorias que nos hicieron vibrar de alegría.
Invierte en gradas y estadios, recibe alquiler y gástate el dinero en la tienda oficial.
Sé astuto y mantente alerta, porque sólo hay sitio para uno en el primer puesto.
A los demás les espera la bancarrota. Ahora, los seguidores del Real Betis tienen la posibilidad de seguir disfrutando con esta exclusiva edición oficial de MONOPOLY.

Name: Monopoly: Edición País Vasco
Description:
Monopoly Edición País Vasco / Monopoly Euskadi Edizioa 
Play in the different settings of the Basque country such as the Bizkaia bridge or the Traineras regattas and taste their pintxos and typical Basque cuisine dishes while you walk around the board.

Go to the Bosque de Oma and the Ría de Bilbao through the wonderful provinces that make up the Basque Country - will you get your rent paid?

Invest in houses and hotels and win the game.

Name: Space Base: Biodome
Description:
With prosperity and peace comes innovation. U.E.S. scientists explore new theories in faster-than-light travel and quantum shifting. A breakthrough in Hypernet technology transports both beings and goods throughout the galaxy at an even greater rate at longer distances, allowing rapid colonization in the Border Zone.

The Biodome micro-expansion features new ships and colonies that add variety and exciting new abilities to your Space Base games. New ship cards take the form of a Hypernet Craft that can be placed in any of your sectors instead of having an assigned sector. Some of the new colonies feature ongoing abilities that give you a power to use for the rest of the game instead of just scoring victory points.

Biodome is available direct from the publisher's website.

-description from publisher

Name: Monopoly: Edición Navarra
Description:
Live the life of an ambitious merchant in the fast-paced world of real estate with this Navarre edition of Monopoly.

Play in the different settings of Navarre.
From the statue of Ernest Hemingway in the bullring to the Royal Palace of Olite, passing through the Collegiate Church of Santa María de Roncesvalles, there are many places in Navarra where you can have fun.

Name: Valley of the Kings: Premium Edition – Necropolis
Description:
Take on the role of Egyptian nobles at the time of the pharaohs, preparing for death and burial in the Valley of the Kings. Necropolis adds a new Grave Goods set of artifact cards, including funerary cones, shabti box, hypocephalus, and other treasures. New unique cards give players more combo-building powers and add variety to your games. 10 new pharaohs grant players the option to customize their starting abilities, creating a new play experience each game.

Necropolis is a micro-expansion that will be available on direct from the publisher's website.

-description from publisher

Name: Medieval Mayhem
Description:
In Medieval Mayhem, a co-op game for 2-4 players, play the role of 4 heroes: Rogre, Emera, Gallandor, and Kijam as they attempt to rescue all 24 villagers from the dragon Malevol. Actions include moving, rescuing, transferring, and dropping off villagers. Work together and utilize cards from the deck as well as hero effects!

Contents include 24 Meeples, 8 Player Tokens, 4 Hero Cards, 16 Location Cards, 16 Action Cards, and 1 Rulebook.

INTRODUCTION
Malevol, the fabled wicked dragon, has emerged and has his eyes set on villagers. Four brave heroes: Rogre, Emera, Kijam, and Gallandor, must rescue the villagers and drop them off in Farlorn Village. However, if Malevol emerges, and the heroes aren’t on Safe Haven spaces while rescuing villagers, the villagers will die! An orc, a mage, a knight, and an elf must team up to save the villagers from Malevol’s wrath!

OBJECTIVE
Your team must rescue 16 of the 24 villagers. Use action cards and hero effects to help make the objective easier!

GAMEPLAY
Select a player to go first, then play proceeds to the left. A player may perform (3) actions in any order of their choosing. Actions:

Move: Move your token one space vertically or horizontally (diagonal is not allowed).  Your piece must move onto a Location Card your first turn and may never leave the game area again.

Transfer: When two players’ tokens occupy the same Location Card, a transfer may occur.  You may give one Villager that has been rescued to the other player.  Each transfer costs one Action.

Rescue: A player’s token must occupy the same space as the villager being rescued. When moving, be sure to move the villager next to your token.

Drop-Off: When you get to the Village, perform a Drop-Off action to ensure the villager is same from harm.

Each player has one turn each round. After the round ends, reveal a card from the Action Deck. If it is an Action Card, any player may add it to their hand and play it on any of their next turns at no extra action cost. Action cards are discarded after use. However, if it is Malevol, anyone who does not occupy a Safe Haven Location Card will lose 1 villager, then shuffle Malevol back into the Action Card deck. Lost villagers are removed from the game. Each player has an effect that may be used during the game; this does not cost an action to use and can be used any time when applicable. NOTE: Unless otherwise stated, only 1 villager can be rescued per Hero card before drop-off.

GAME END
The game ends when 16 villagers have been rescued and dropped off at the village; in this case, your team wins! The game will also end if 9 villagers die from Malevol; in this case, your team loses.

-description from designer

Name: Monopoly: Edición Galicia
Description:
Live the life of an ambitious merchant in the fast-paced world of real estate with this Monopoly Galicia edition.

Discover the essence of Galicia in this amazing edition of Monopoly.

Its capital, Santiago de Compostela, is the final destination for pilgrims on the famous Camino de Santiago. Its landscapes gather lush valleys and impressive beaches. On its coastline, bathed by the Cantabrian Sea and the Atlantic Ocean, there are areas of spectacular cliffs such as those of A Costa da Morte or the incredible National Park of the Atlantic Islands of Galicia.

Play between charming seaside and inland towns and cities such as Santiago de Compostela, A Coruña, Ferrol, Lugo, Orense, Pontevedra or Vigo. Some of its monuments, such as the Tower of Hercules or the Walls of Lugo (both declared World Heritage by UNESCO) will surely leave you impressed.

Name: Monopoly: Edición Cantabria
Description:
Discover the essence of Cantabria in this amazing edition of Monopoly.

Cantabria has its own edition of the popular Monopoly game, where all the beauty of the region is reflected.

The Cantabrian version of the popular board game is based on the most emblematic places of the entire region and not focused on just one city, reflecting the beauty of Cantabria

The dynamics are the same as ever, only this time, the exciting game of real estate, has in its procurement list, the Cave of Altamira , the Nature Park Cabarceno , the Cave of the Soplao or the Field Golf Abra de Pas. But these are not the only properties that can be bought in the game since Salvé beaches , Oyambre or the Sardinero , share the limelight with some of the most outstanding areas of the region such as the mountain stew or the sobaos and quesadas.

Name: Rock Paper Scissors Duellerz
Description:
Rock Paper Scissors Duellerz is a fast, fun and strategic card game for all ages.

Duellerz is rock, paper, scissors....but not as you know it.  We've added in special card tiers (Singles, Doubles and Rainbows) plus some game changing cards (Rock N Roll, Steal and Freeze).

It's simple.  Each round, players play one card from their hand of five cards, with highest ranked card taking the pile.  Rainbows beat Doubles, Doubles beat Singles and Rock N Roll beats them all.  Or to mix things up you can play a special Steal card (to steal the highest ranked played card) or Freeze card (to Freeze the round for players to each play another card in the round).

After each round, player pick up to re-stock their hand to five cards.  Once all cards from the game pile have been played, players count their win pile.

Win more cards than your opponents to become the Rock Paper Scissors Duellerz champion!

-description from publisher

Name: Gingerbreads
Description:
Gingerbreads is a cooperative family game, in which the players will be helping uncle Otto with his order: baking polyominos of gingerbread, coating them with different-colored icing and storing them in the box. If the players fill the box completely before the icing runs out, they win!

During the game the players take turns, going clockwise. On their turn, the player must perform one of the following actions:

• Bake a gingerbread: roll the die — its face will show the gingerbread shape(s) the player will be able to bake during their turn. They choose one shape and take the topmost gingerbread from the corresponding pile for themselves. Each player may have only one gingerbread in front of themselves at a time. The player may also adjust the die result, discard their current gingerbread, or refresh one of the gingerbread piles — but they will have to discard an Icing sphere — the most valuable resource — for that!

• Coat their gingerbread with one Icing sphere: the player chooses 1 of the 9 available Icing spheres from the dispenser that would fit their gingerbread and place it on the corresponding slot of the tile.

• If the player can’t or doesn’t want to do anything of the above, they must discard an Icing sphere from the dispenser.

There are three complexity levels: easy, medium, and hard.
Easy level: No die rolling — the kids bake gingerbreads of any shapes. 

Hard level: Malfunction cards are added — they affect the Icing dispenser and introduce different restrictions for the current turn.

-description from publisher

Name: Dice Fishing
Description:
Dice Fishing is a fast-paced and exciting dice-rolling game that feels a lot like real fishing!

Each round, the players take turns rolling 6 custom Bait dice.

There is a common row of Fish cards that is replenished after each player’s turn. Each card requires a certain set of bait to be placed on it. If all slots of the card are filled, the fish starts biting! The players can guess which of the 7 fish types they are about to catch — zander, trout, perch, pike, sturgeon, salmon, or ide — but they won’t know for sure until they flip the card and see it!

The larger the fish, the harder it is to catch it. Moreover, every fish might get away! In order to increase your chances, you will be mastering your fishing skills by resolving different Opportunity cards that will allow manipulating your rolls and the assortment of fish.

During the game, the players score additional Achievement tokens for different sets of their fish and as soon as anyone collects 7 different fish, they score the endgame Achievement token. After the final scoring, whoever has the most VP wins!

-description from publisher

Name: Mini Macaron Madness
Description:
In Mini Macaroon Madness, your job is to get trays of macaroons out to customers quickly. Mix up flavors and combinations in the right amount to earn favor and become the best macaroon baker.

Game Components
12 Macaroon Tokens
36 Macaroon Tray Cards
8 Dice

Set Up & Quick Play
Shuffle macaroon tokens and macaron tray cards.
Lay out a grid with 4 macarons on both the left and right. Roll the dice and make 4 columns on the top and bottom.  Leave space for macaron tray cards to be laid out in a 4x4 grid. Each player receives 4 macaron tray cards.
On your turn, play as many macaron trays into the grid as possible. They need to match one of the two dice options and 1 of the 2 macaron options. Special action cards allow you to add to your turn. Use all 4 cards and receive 4 more. Continue to play until you are unable to play and then restock to 4 cards and end your turn.
When players complete a vertical column, they receive an extra macaron card and roll a die in the column. They may continue their turn.
When players complete a horizontal row, they score 1 point. They change up one of the two macarons and continue their turn.  They may score additional points during their turn in that same row if they can place at least one macaron tray.  When they are unable to play the row of trays is placed in the discard pile.  
Play continues until a player scores 6 points.  Keep track of your score on paper.

-description from publisher

Name: Helio
Description:
As a balloon bouquet builder at Helio Balloon shop fill up orders as quickly as you can.   Become a Master Balloon Blower at  Helio when you reach 20 balloons strings or more in completed balloon bouquets.

Game Components
48 Balloon Tokens
36 Balloon Bouquet String Cards
6 colored dice

Set Up & Quick Play
Shuffle balloon string cards.  Deal 4 to each player face up.
Place Balloon tokens in middle of playing area.
Players take turns rolling all 6 dice.  Players match dice to cards by number of balloon strings or by color.  Some dice may not be matched, set these dice aside as you complete your turn. Players exchange dice matched to cards one at a time for a balloon. If a player fills up the number of strings that card is completed and earns them 1 point per string.  Leave one balloon on the card and place it to the right of your playing area. Return remaining balloons to draw pile.  Add 1 new card per card filled.
Next player rolls for balloon and play continues.
Play continues until a player reaches 20 balloon strings, on full completed balloon bouquets.
Turns continue until each players has an equal number of turns. All Helio employees count up all their completed bouquet strings.  In the case of a tie the player with the most bouquets wins.

-description from publisher

Name: Kinswinds
Description:
Kinswinds is born of a desire for a deception game that focused more on information control and less on guesswork and odds.

The game attempts to simulate the power of suggestion, encouraging players to invest in the strongest card suits but also encouraging attempts to influence which suits other players believeâ€‹ are the strongest, not only through bluffing but also through actions.

Players move together through 5 steps whilst passing, discarding and activating card abilities, all of this giving them several options for altering the distribution of the cards and thus the score value of those cards. Players choose which cards they will score on during the game and in the fifth step can take a small points penalty to force the game to end if they think their chosen cards are worth the most.

At this point all hands are revealed, each player's chosen score cards are revealed and their value is calculated, the highest scoring player being declared the winner.

The game takes seconds to get running and comes in a pocket sized deckbox.

-description from designer

Name: Monopoly: Bilbao
Description:
Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Bilbao, in the Basque country, in Spain.

Name: Linjaa
Description:
Creating the longest line, flip your opponent's plan or just enjoy the puzzle: it's up to you to choose a winning strategy.
Each card in the game is unique, so it's not easy to form the longest line.
Win or lose, you always create a compelling pattern with Linjaa.
